wikipedia_page.main: Heather Blanche Goodman (born 30 March 1935) is a fell runner and former canoeist from Great Britain. She competed at the 1972 Summer Olympics in Munich, West Germany, as a member of the British canoe slalom team, the first time the event was featured at the games. Goodman finished 13th in the women's K-1 slalom event.She took up fell running in 1995, and only ten years later, aged 70, won the female over-65 gold medal at the fifth World Masters Mountain Running Championships in Keswick, Cumbria.
